benchmark_details.name: ALLVB (All-in-One Long Video Understanding Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: ALLVB is a long video understanding benchmark designed to assess the capabilities of Multi-modal LLMs (MLLMs) across 9 major video understanding tasks with 1,376 videos, each averaging nearly 2 hours, and a total of 252,420 Q&A pairs.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive and challenging benchmark for evaluating long video understanding capabilities of MLLMs.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark currently includes only movie videos.

data.source: 1,376 feature-length movies collected from open-source websites
data.annotation: Automated using GPT-4 with human quality control

methodology.calculation: Accuracy calculated based on the number of correct answers identified by models against the total Q&As.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better understanding of long video content by the modeled LLM.
methodology.validation: Validation through rigorous manual review and testing various MLLMs.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark does not target specific demographic characteristics.
